qas.question: What type of view do Christians take on God?
How much can belief in God vary in Hinduism?

answers.text: ranging from monotheistic to polytheistic to atheistic

qas.question: What view does the Jewish community take on God?

plausible_answers.text: can at best only play a supportive role in one's personal path to salvation

qas.question: What role does Mahayana tradition have in salvation?

plausible_answers.text: give a more prominent place to notions of the divine

qas.question: How is the concept of God handled in dharmic religions?

context: There is no clear consensus on the nature or even the existence of God. The Abrahamic conceptions of God include the <a3_0><a5_0>monotheistic<a5_0/><a3_0/> definition of God in Judaism, the <a0_0><a6_0>trinitarian<a6_0/><a0_0/> view of Christians, and the Islamic concept of God. The <a4_0>dharmic<a4_0/> religions <b9_0>differ<b9_0/> in their view of the divine: views of God in Hinduism vary <b10_0>by <a1_0>region, sect, and caste<b10_0/><a1_0/>, <a2_0>ranging from <a7_0><b8_0>monotheistic to polytheistic to atheistic<b8_0/><a2_0/>.<a7_0/> Divinity was recognized by the historical Buddha, particularly Śakra and Brahma. However, other sentient beings, including gods, <b11_0>can at best only play a supportive role in one's personal path to salvation<b11_0/>. Conceptions of God in the latter developments of the Mahayana tradition <b12_0>give a more prominent place to notions of the divine<b12_0/>.[citation needed]
